channel.title: Create an EKS Cluster :: Container Registry Security with Vulnerability Scanning and Policy Enforcement
channel.description: Excellent. Foundation is set. Now we bring our cloud environment to life. Our next step is to provision the core AWS infrastructure using the tools you just configured. We will create the Kubernetes cluster where your applications will run and the container registry where your images will be stored. Create the EKS Cluster Configuration We will use eksctl to build the cluster. The best practice is to define the cluster in a configuration file, which you can then commit to your Git repository for version control and reproducibility.
